dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denham and Englehorn talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Denham, you know the reasons for hurrying as well as I do. The insurance company has found out we're carrying explosives, and the Marshal will be aboard tomorrow or next day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose if we make a legal case of it, we'll be tied up for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With ship's articles falsified and ammunition enough aboard to blow up the harbor? (he takes a bomb from case on floor) And what do you think the Marshall will say to these new gas-bombs? According to you one of them is powerful enough to knock out an elephant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pacing up and down) We've got to get to where we're going before the monsoon starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can trust me to get you through a blow, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get sore, Skipper. But you know what it means to hit the tropical rainy season when we're making an outdoor picture. Months wasted, money gone, and nothing to show for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But still you always bring back a picture and everyone says, "There is only one Carl Denham."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll and Weston come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weston! I was just going ashore to ring you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd known that, I'd have waited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet the Skipper. (to Englehorn) This is Weston, the theatrical agent. (they shake hands) And this is Driscoll, the first mate. Well, where's the girl, Weston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be done, Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? It's got to done. (Weston shakes his head in silence) Look here, Weston. The Actor's Equity and the Hays outfit have interfered with every girl I've tried to hire; now every agent in town has shut down on me. All but you. You know I'm square -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows you're square, Denham but you've got a reputation for recklessness that can't be glossed over. And then you're so secretive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When even the skipper and the mate don't know where they're going -- (he shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are. I've got a conscience, Denham. I can't send a young, pretty girl, such as you want, on a job like this without telling her what to expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is she to expect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To go off for no one knows how long, to some place you won't even hint at, the only woman on a ship with the toughest mugs I ever looked at. (they all laugh) I mean the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Lord, you'd think I never brought anybody back alive! The Skipper and Driscoll have stuck by me on two trips. They seem healthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we're healthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's different taking a girl into danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I suppose there's no danger in New York? Why, there are dozens of girls in this town tonight in more danger than they'd ever see with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drily) Sure. But they know that kind of danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never had a woman in your other pictures, why do you want one in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Holy mackerel D'ye think I want to haul a woman along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the public - bless 'em - must have a pretty face to look at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody likes romance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there any romance or adventure in the world without a flapper in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Denham, why not make a picture in a monastery? (they all laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me sore. I go out and sweat blood to make a swell picture, and then the exhibitors and critics all say, "if this picture had a love interest, it would gross twice as much." All right, the public wants a girl, and this time I'll give 'em what they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) I don't know where you'll get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weston, I've got to. We've got to sail on the morning tide - we've got to be out of here by daylight -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - there's a good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I hear makes me like this thing less. I'm glad I didn't get you a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are, eh? Well, I'll show you. If you think I'm going to give up just because you can't find a girl with a backbone -- (he is struggling into his overcoat) -- I'm going to make the greatest picture in the world, something that's never been seen or dreamed of. They'll have to invent some new adjectives when I come back. (he is at the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bring back a girl for my picture -- if I have to marry one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO Long Shot - Broadway at night - stock CUT TO Denham walking along, scanning faces as he walks. DISSOLVES of faces of women, Broadway types, bold, indifferent, heavy, ugly - most of them heavily painted. Rapidly passing, as though the camera were Denham looking them over. CUT TO Denham. He shakes his head disgustedly, stops, whe around and starts in another direction, as though he's gi up that part of town, and thought of another possibility. DISSOLVE TO Exterior of a Woman's Mission. A bread-line waiting. Camera moves slowly down the line of faces as thought Denham were looking them over. CUT TO Denham. He shrugs his shoulders in despair, turns away. DISSOLVE TO Exterior of one of those Small Wooden Stands see in the West Forties, a fruit-tobacco and candy shop j big enough for the proprietor and one customer to get int stand of fruit and peanut-roaster on sidewalk. Denham com along, takes out cigarette case, it's empty, he goes in t buy some. We see through window that he is taking cigaret and paying the Greek proprietor. Ann Darrow comes slowly into picture; she hesitates, her goes stealthily toward a piece of fruit.  She is fingering it when the Greek dashes out and seizes She tries to pull her arm away. Denham comes out of shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very excited) Ah-ha! I catch you, you stealer! I catch the cop - you like that, ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she keeps her head bent, struggling weakly to pull away) No-no, I didn't.  Please let me go. I wanted to, but I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had enough dese stealers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dry up. The kid didn't take anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't, truly I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, shut up, Socrates. Here's a dollar. Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greek takes the money and releases Ann who stumbles b against Denham. He catches her round the shoulders and sh half-collapses. Her head falls back on his arm. He has hi first sight of her face. CLOSE UP Ann, her eyes open as she looks up at Denham, terrified. MEDIUM SHOT - Denham, holding Ann. He looks at her. Sudde his face lights up, he snaps his fingers triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up the street) Hi! Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO a one-armed lunch room. Tiled wall, two chair Ann has emptied plate and coffee mug on arm of her chair. Denham in other chair watching her. She sighs happily ove having satisfied her hunger, and leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you. You're very kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fool yourself. I'm not bothering with you just out of kindness. (Ann opens her eyes wide, half-puzzled, half afraid) How come you're in this fix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad luck I guess. There are lots of girls just like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't such a lot who've got your looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing it off) Oh, I can get by in good clothes. But when a girl gets too shabby --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to have an uncle somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever do any acting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to do some extra jobs over at Fort Lee sometimes. Once I got a real part. The studio is shut down now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's you name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann Darrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you one of these city gals who screams at a mouse and faints at a snake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) No, of course not. I'm a country gal - or used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, sister. I've got a job for you. The costumes I've got on board will fit you. (looks at his watch) The Broadway shops will still be open. I'll get you some clothes for yourself. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But - but what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) It's money, and adventure, and fame. It's the thrill of a lifetime. And a long sea-voyage that starts at six tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Wait, I can't - I don't understand - you must tell me - I do want the job so - I was starving - but I can't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denham has been looking at her, puzzled because she hasn' caught his frantic excitement. He suddenly sees what is troubling her. He calms down and goes back and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. You got me wrong. Nix, sister, nix. This is strictly business. I'm no chaser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly) I only wanted to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Sure you did. I dot excited and forgot you didn't understand it. Listen, I'm Carl Denham. Ever hear of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye-es. Yes. You make moving pictures. In jungles and places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. And I've picked you for the lead in my next picture. We sail at six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long way from here. Think, Ann, a long voyage, easy living, the warm blue sea, moonlight on the water - isn't that better than tramping New York trying to keep out of the gutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost whispers) Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm square, Ann. And I'll be square with you. No funny business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning over her chair and looking straight at her) Trust me. And keep your chin up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann looks at him for a moment, then he holds out his hand She takes it and they shake. FADE OUT. FADE IN - deck of ship at dawn, getting under way. Crew b casting off lines, moving stuff on deck. A tug is puffing alongside. Driscoll on fo'c'sle head directing. MEDIUM SHOT - Ann in same dress, but wearing a heavy loos coat Denham has bought her. She climbs to fo'c'sle head, watching this strange new world. Driscoll backs into scene without seeing her. He is shout at a sailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry that line aft! Aft, you farmer! Back there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings his arm round behind him in a violent full-arme gesture and hits Ann in the face. She staggers back again the rail and nearly falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Who the -- What are you going up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly, hand to her face) I just wanted to see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gruffly) Well, I'm sorry. You're the girl Denham found at the last minute, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm - I'm awfully excited. It's all so strange, and I've never been on a ship before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I've never been on a ship with a woman before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you don't think much of women on ships, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They're a cock-eyed nuisance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try not to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got in the way already. Better stay below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! The whole voyage! (she smiles at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates, then says in a softened tone -) Say, I didn't apologize very good for hitting you. That was an awful sock in the jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll stares at her doubtfully, she looks up and meets gaze. Their eyes hold for a moment, then two short toots a tug alongside, answered by one blast from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clasping her hands and peering into the mist) We're off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO - Long shot - Miniature ship at sea - DAY DISSOLVE TO - The deck of the ship at sea. A calm tropica afternoon. Ann and Charley, the Chinese cook, at rail. Charley with enormous tub of potatoes, peeling them. Ann making an intricate knot with a bit of rope's end, foolin with it as she talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley, how many potatoes do you suppose you've peeled since we left New York six weeks ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailors eat an awful lot, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All time eat. No can fill up. Some day my go back to China, never see no more potato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann finishes the knot and tugs at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. That's fourteen knots I've learned to tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty soon now you be same sailor. Only don't eat so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, then looks around with a contented sigh) I'd like to be a sailor. Isn't the sea wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drily) Oh yes, very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it wasn't so nice up north when it was cold and rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ocean very fine when you order weather how you like all same like eggs for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll strolls in. Charley gets up and moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been all morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying on costumes for Mr. Denham. He's going to make some tests of me this afternoon, here on deck, when the light's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tests? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - to see which side of my face looks best - and all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very gruff) Both sides looks all right to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yes, but you're not the movie director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was, you wouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's a nice thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no place for a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignantly) I wish you wouldn't keep harping on that. It's very mean of you. Anybody'd think I'd been a lot of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll grunts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very cross) I haven't! You can't say I've been one bit of trouble to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him, waits, then anxiously) Have I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see - Well, how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just your being here's a trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mournfully) Oh dead. I thought everything was going to nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll looks at her downcast expression, wiggles uncomfortably and at last blurts an attempt at consolatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, you're swell. Women can't help being a bother. I guess they're made that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddly enough, this doesn't cheer her up very much. But sh draws a long breath and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, anyhow, I've had the happiest time of my life on this old ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll is a little touched by this. He gives her a quic look and says awkwardly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why - that's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little pause. Driscoll thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'ye really mean that, Ann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Everyone's so nice to me - Mr. Denham and the Skipper - Don't you think the Skipper is a sweet old lamb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) I'd hate to have him hear me say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann laughs and picks up Ignatz, the monkey, who cuddles d in her lap contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignatz is nice to me too. He likes me better than he does anyone else on board, don't you Iggy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denham approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty and the Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I never thought I was handsome, but - (they all laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go put on a costume, Ann. Light's good for those tests now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be a minute, Mr. Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts down Ignatz and goes. Denham scratches Ignatz' h watches him for moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half aloud) Beauty and the Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Denham, I've going to do some butting-in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your trouble, Driscoll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do we find out where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Pretty soon now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell us what happens when we get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I? I'm no fortune-teller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But hang it, you must have some idea what you're after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going soft on me, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm not for myself. But Ann --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you've gone soft on her? I've got enough on my hands without a love affair to complicate things. Better cut it out, Jack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sullenly) Love affair! You think I'm going to fall for any dams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing) It never fails. Some big hard boiled egg goes goofy over a pretty face, and bingo! He cracks up and gets sappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Who's getting sappy? I haven't run out on you, have I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. You're a good tough guy, Jack. But if beauty gets you -- (he stops, then laughs a little) Why, I'm going right into a theme song!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sulky) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the idea for my picture. The Beast was a tough guy, Jack. He could lick the world. But when he saw Beauty, she got him. He went soft, he forgot his wisdom, and the little fellers licked him. Think it over, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming up) Mr. Denham, the Skipper says will you please come up on the bridge? We've reached the position you marked, he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jack. You're in on this. I'm going to spill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO bridge. Englehorn leaning over chart; Denham Driscoll across table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing with dividers) Here's your noon position. 2 South, 90 East; you promised me some information when we reached these latitudes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at chart) 'Way west of Sumatra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And way out of any waters I know. I know the East Indies like my own hand, but I was never here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Where do we go from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South-West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South-West! But there is nothing - nothing for thousands of miles. What about food? So many in the crew makes the food melt away. And water? And coal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Skipper. We're not going thousands of miles. (he takes a wallet from his breast pocket and very carefully opens two pieces of paper - spreads over on table before Englehorn) That's the island we're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The position -- (he leans down, straightens up) I'll get the big chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't find that island on any chart. That one there was made up by the skipper of a Norwegian Barque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Listen. A canoe with natives from this island was blown out to sea. When the barque picked them up, there was only one alive. He died before they reached port, but not before the skipper had pieced together a description of the island and got a fairly good idea of where it lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get hold of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years ago, in Singapore, going home from my last trip. I've known that skipper for years. He knew I'd be interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he believe it himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I do. See, here's what the island looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unfolds second piece of paper. INSERT crude sketch of island, Denham's hand pointing to various features. Float Denham's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a long sandy peninsula. The only possible landing place is through this reef. The rest of the shore-line is sheer precipice, hundreds of feet high. And across the base of that peninsula, cutting it off from the rest of the island, is a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO Med. Shot - Denham, Driscoll, Englehorn. They star Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Built so long ago that the people who live there now have slipped back, forgotten the high civilization that built it. But it's as strong today as it was centuries ago. The natives keep that wall in repair. They need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something on the other side - something they fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hostile tribe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing a long breath) Did you ever hear of -- KONG?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) Why -- yes. Some Malay superstition. A god or a spirit or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, neither beast nor man. Monstrous, all-powerful -- still living, still holding that island in the grip of deadly fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Englehorn and Driscoll look skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every legend has a basis of truth. I tell you there's something on that island that no white man has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you expect to photograph it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's there, you bet I'll photograph it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very skeptical) Suppose it doesn't like having it's picture taken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now you know why I brought those cases of gas-bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll and Englehorn stare at Denham, then look at each other. Englehorn shrugs, reaches for the homemade chart. DISSOLVE TO- Exterior forward deck of ship - Day. Denham camera set up. Ann comes in, in Beauty and Beast costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you picked out the Beauty and the Beast costume!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the prettiest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Stand over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sort of nervous. Suppose I don't photograph well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (busy with camera) Don't let that worry you. If I hadn't been sure of that, I wouldn't have brought you half way round the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shall I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squints through the viewfinder, throws camera over and locks it) Now when I start cranking hold it a minute, then turn slowly toward me. Look at me, look surprised, then smile a little, listen and then laugh. All right, camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does as he has said. CUT TO fo'c'sle head, several members of crew peering out watching with great interest. Charley among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks kinda silly, don't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sure a pretty dame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think maybe he like take my picture, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them camera cost money. Shouldn't think he'd risk it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO Denham and Ann

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fine. I'm going to try a filter on this one. (he fusses around, changing lens, etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you always take the pictures yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since a trip I made to Africa. I'd have got a swell picture of a charging rhino, but the cameraman got scared. The damned fool. I was right there with a rifle. Seemed he didn't trust me to get the rhino before it got him. I haven't fooled with cameramen since. Do the trick myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO the bridge. Englehorn and Driscoll leaning over, watching Ann and Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he's crazy, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just enthusiastic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this yarn about unknown islands and monstrous gods --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pays us well to take him where he wants to go. If the island exists, we will find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO Denham and Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Ann, stand there. Look down. When I start to crank, look up slowly. You're quite calm, don't expect to see anything. Follow my directions. All right -- camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cranks. He gets more excited through this scene, tryin force her to feel the emotions he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- look up. Slowly. You see nothing yet. Look higher. Still higher. That's it. Now you see it. You're amazed. You can't believe it. Your eyes open wider. It's horrible, but you can't look away. What is it Ann? What can you do?  No chances for you, no escape. Helpless, Ann, you're helpless. One chance -- if you can scream. Your throat's paralyzed. Try to scream, Ann. Try. If you didn't see, perhaps you could scream. Throw you arms across your eyes, and scream, Ann, scream for your life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has followed his directions. CUT TO bridge. Driscoll and Englehorn, watching Denham an Ann. Ann's scream floats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grasping Englehorn's arm) What's he think she's really going to see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN, bridge in fog, outside wheel-house. Denham, Ann, Driscoll, Englehorn, at rail peering ahead. Through this dialogue intercut shots of look-out in bow, man in crows nest, sailor heaving lead, and sailors clustered at bulwa on main deck, watching for island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This infernal fog! Sure of your position, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very nervous, but offended at suggestion) Of course. Last night, before the fog shut down, I got a good sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must be near the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't see it when this fog lifts we never shall. We've quartered these parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO sailor with lead. He lets go, line runs through hi hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bottom at 30 fathoms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO bridge as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Of course that Norwegian skipper was guessing at the position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will we know it's the right island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very tense, answering mechanically) The mountain that looks like a skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'd forgotten. You told me that. Skull Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom! 20 fathoms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shallowing fast, Driscoll, dead slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll goes to telegraph, sounds of bells to engine-roo and reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curse the fog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen fathoms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she draw, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever looks at person addressed. All eyes ahead, straining through fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! Hear anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a slight pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakers ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Englehorn jumps for telegraph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten fathoms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jingle of telegraph, noise of reversing engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellowing at fo'c'sle) Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rattle of anchor chain through hawse-pipe, splash of anch more jingle of telegraph. After noise dies down, Driscoll speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not breakers. That's drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long distant mutter of drums rolling. DISSOLVE TO: Boats being lowered, Bos'n giving orders. CUT TO bridge, Englehorn with binocular. Denham, Ann and Driscoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Skipper, see anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a living thing. I think there are more houses in the thick bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny they haven't spotted us. I think the whole population would be on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faint throbbing of drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they have seen us and are signalling. Well, Skipper, do you believe me now? There's Skull Mountain, the wall - everything just like my funny map. Come on, let's get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve men go with you. The rest stay aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge of the gas bombs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy. That young feller. (points down on deck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Leave the 2nd Mate aboard, Skipper. I need you, you may be able to talk to these birds ashore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going ashore with you, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ought not to go till we find out what goes on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good-naturedly) Say, who's running this show? I've learned by experience to keep my cast and my cameras right with me. You never can tell when you'll want 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's crazy to risk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, go on, Jack. Get busy. Deal out the rifles and ammunition. And pick me a couple of huskies to carry my stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll goes reluctantly. Denham shakes his head over hi then Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the costume box. We might get a swell shot right away if we're lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO shot of beach, boats approaching. Village and wall glassed. DISSOLVE TO shot from beach, showing loaded boats approaching. Drums louder, of course. CUT TO boats beaching, people getting out, uploading stuf Denham puts camera on tripod, one sailor shoulders it, another with magazine case, third with costume box, fourt and fifth with trade-goods in boxes. Jimmy with case of bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fellers with the camera stay close to me. Where's Jimmy with the bombs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Stick around. And watch your step. There's enough trichloride in that case to put a herd of hippos to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What queer-looking boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outrigger canoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll, have two men stay with the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All attended to, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) Now, all set? Ready, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming up) Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start up the beach. CUT TO village. Wall visible over roofs. Party enters. Drums much louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a soul in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wall, Skipper! What d'ye say to that, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colossal! It might almost be Egyptian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what's on the other side? That's what I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awe-struck) Who do you suppose could have built it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to be impressed) Aw, I went up to Angkor once. That's bigger than this - and nobody knows who built it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a feeling of something even more important than a picture pending, but trying to strike his usual note) Oh, boy! What a chance! What a picture!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chant begins, rising in volume. They all stand frozen Ann clutches Driscoll's arm. Sailors frightened. Chant di down to a mutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking himself) Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all move forward cautiously. TRUCK WITH THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear that! They're saying Kong! Kong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you'll be able to speak their lingo Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you catch any words yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. It sounds something like the language the Nias Islanders speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you suppose is happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up to some of their heathen tricks. Now don't go rushing out to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly, but bubbling with excitement) All right. But isn't it exciting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I wish we'd left you on the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach masking house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Easy row. Stay here till I see what goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop in a group behind house. Denham looks round cautiously. CUT TO what he sees. The Ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy mackerel! What a show! Skipper, get a look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Englehorn carefully goes forward and peeps around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever see anything like that before? If I can steal a shot before they see us -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He beckons to sailor carrying camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You with the camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor starts forward with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Driscoll) I want to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on and look, but be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann looks around house. Denham moves beyond and starts setting up. Chant begins to rise. As it reaches forte, Ch sees them and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bado! Dama pati vego!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ceremony stops, natives turn and stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, they see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's beat it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to run. Driscoll seizes and holds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on there! What are you running for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No use trying to hide now. Everybody come out here in plain sight. Put up a bold front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll, Ann and sailors come forward in a group a few p behind Denham and Englehorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bado! Maka mini tau ansaro.(Wait! Two warriors come with me.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In silence, the Chief with two warriors close behind him advances through the crowd of natives. The women in the c begin to slip away. The group of whites watch in tense silence the approach o the Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, let's scram outa this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand still, you fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Group of sailors are fingering their rifles, shifting nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder without looking away from Chief) Steady, boys. Don't get nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann takes hold of Driscoll's arm. He puts his hand on her without looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never let a native see you're worried, boys. Bluff 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chief stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watu! Tama di? Tama di? (Stop! Who are you? Who are you?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Skipper, make him a friendly speech. (advance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) Tabe! Bala kum nono hi. Bala! Bala! (Greeting! We are your friends. Friends! Friends!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly) Bala reri! Tasko! Tasko! (We don't want friends, Go! Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He understands you, Skipper! What's he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telling us to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk him out of it. Ask him what goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vana di humya? Malem ani humya vana? (What are you doing? What is that woman doing?) (he points to girl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ani saba Kong! (She is the bride of Kong!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The natives all murmur "Saba Kong!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says the girl there is the bride of Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! Find out what they're going to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Witch Doctor rushes forward, very angry. He addresses Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dama si kasi! Dama si kasi! Punya bas! Punya! (Strangers have seen! It is finished.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Englehorn) Tasko! (Go!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be the witch-doctor. He says the ceremony is spoiled because we have seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the word for friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bala.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm the old boy down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He advances with outspread hands, saying, "Bala! Bala!" Englehorn hesitates for a moment, then steps forward too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellowing) Punya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warriors move menacingly forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the looks of this, Denham. The women have cleared out. That's a bad sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief sees Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to the natives) Sita! Malem! Malem me pakeno! (Look! The woman! The woman of gold!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natives all look at her and murmur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says look at the golden woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blondes are scarce around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malem ma pakapo! Kong wa bisa! Kow bisa para Kong! (The woman of gold! Kong's gift! A gift for Kong.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gift for Kong, he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Lord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dama, tebo malem na hi? (Strangers, sell woman to us?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wants to buy her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sani sita malem ati - (pointing to sacrificial victim) - kow dia malem ma pakeno. (I will give six women like this for you woman of gold.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's offering to trade us six of his girls for Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann gasps, tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got her into this, Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tida, tida! Malem ati rota na hi. (No, no! Our woman stays with us.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief growls menacingly. Warriors take another step forwa Sailors finger their rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take her back to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better all get out before they think to cut us off from the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. But tell him we'll come back tomorrow to make friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dulu hi tego. Bala. Dulu. (Tomorrow we come. Friends. Tomorrow.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief does not move, glares at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get going, Ann. Don't act scared. Everything's all right. Smile, Ann. Talk to Jack. Keep your chin up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann, very frightened, but smiling gallantly, does as he t her. She and Driscoll retreat slowly, pretending unconcer The sailors fall back one by one, Englehorn and Denham la Denham cocks his hat over one eye and begins to whistle carelessly, one hand on his revolver. As they reach the corner of masking house. DISSOLVE TO deck in moonlight - Ann and Charley on hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and an enormous wall, Charley, all the way across that piece of land where we went ashore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What fashion that girl do -- that girl with flowers on her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poor thing, she looked -- as though she was too frightened to feel frightened. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding wisely) Sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief said she was the bride of Kong. Charley, what do you suppose Kong is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guess he very big joss this place. People here plenty scared. You don't worry. No can help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignatz gallops past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's Ignatz! He's broken loose again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley grabs at him and misses. Ignatz goes down the dec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch him, Charley. He'll get in the cabins and break things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My catch him. Bad devil, come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes off in pursuit. Ann watches, laughing. CUT TO Sailor on watch in bow. He looks round, yawns, sit down and makes himself comfortable. CUT TO Ann on hatch. Driscoll enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you in bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep. Those drums make me nervous, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Denham's off his nut, taking you ashore today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was -- sort of scared there for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh! You weren't the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what we do next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what's worrying me. Denham's such a fool for risks. No telling what he'll ask you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what he did for me, I'll do anything he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk like that. When it comes to getting a picture, he's crazy enough to try anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't go back on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I think what might have happened today -- if anything happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Why then you wouldn't be bothered with a woman on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very staccato) Don't laugh. I'm scared for you. I'm sort of - I'm scared of you, too. Ann, I -- I guess I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, both startled by this conclusion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! You hate women!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still surprised over his discovery) You aren't -- women. I love you. Ann, I don't suppose -- you don't feel like that about me -- do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann looks at him soberly for a moment, then takes a step nearer. Just as his arms go around her, a hail from the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Driscoll! Are you on deck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifts his head long enough to reply) Yes, sir. (then bends over Ann again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please come up here a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (same business) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait here for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll kisses her once more and goes reluctantly. Ann leans back against the bulwarks with a happy smile, looking after him. The Witch Doctor rises noiselessly behind her, and withou sound she is seized and lifted over the rail. THE BRIDGE. NIGHT. Englehorn, Denham, Driscoll - talking chart table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tomorrow morning, pick out the men to go ashore. Couple of those nervous boys you better leave aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Denham wants you to break out the trade goods the first thing tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll try a little bribery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still hoping to make friends with that bunch ashore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. We've got to. I've got to find out what Kong is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) He's their tribal legend, their god, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You planning to make movies of a fairy story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know Kong's only a legend or a fairy story? That wall wasn't built for fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said yourself it was built so long ago the people who live here now don't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but they've kept it in damn good repair. Did you see how those gates were fastened? They're meant to keep something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Englehorn and Driscoll exchange skeptical looks. Noise of drums increase suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at watch) After ten. And they're still at is ashore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could only take pictures by firelight! I'd sneak back there now and get a scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Be sensible. We're lucky to be all safe aboard tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to Driscoll, who has crossed over and is peering down onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is is, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- er -- I was looking for Ann. She's gone below, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about turning in, Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not for me tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've set a watch in the bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Englehorn shakes his head stubbornly. Driscoll starts to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well, I'll sit up with you then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Driscoll, I wish you'd take a star sight. See how our position checks up with what I got last night before we ran into the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll gets out the instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Yes sir. I guess it's been a long time since the map-makers got a brand new island to put down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO Charley, on afterdeck, tying Ignatz and scold him in Chinese. Ignatz chattering and scolding right back him. SHOT of bow watch, having a peaceful nap. DISSOLVE TO Bridge, interior - Englehorn and Driscoll ben over chart, making calculations. Denham half asleep in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's about it. (marking chart) We'll make absolutely sure tomorrow noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denham yawns, stretches, looks at watch, crosses and look toward shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About midnight. Hey, look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crosses and looks) Torches going through the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the night before election.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noise of drums increases suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to 'em, will you? Wonder what's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO main deck. Driscoll speaking to Charley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My don't know, sir. My not see Missy one, two hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess, she's in her cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes off. Charley takes a long round deck, sees someth near rail. Goes over, picks it up. A native bracelet of w straw. He examines it for a moment, suddenly realizes wha means, jumps and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On deck! On deck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stamps frantically on deck, turns and runs for the bri Man on watch in bow runs to rail of fo'c'sle head and sho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands on deck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO bridge. Charley runs into Englehorn and Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look sir! My found on deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A native bracelet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy black man that place comes this place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll arrives on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's turning out the crew? What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley found this. Some one's been aboard. Search the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Where's Ann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her cabin -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she isn't! I just looked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes out. Confused sound of sailors' voices from dec below. Englehorn leans from wheel-house window, shouts do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bos'n!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from below) Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man the boats. Serve out the rifles. Search the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bos'n's whistle is heard, creak and thump of davits. Englehorn takes his revolver from chart-table drawer, examines it, puts it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats, Skipper? D'ye think -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (significantly) They may have stolen something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a moment, as they start out. DISSOLVE TO wall and Great Gate. The gate is being opened natives. Procession passes through, taking Ann to the alt People crowding to top of wall. CUT TO exterior of wall, projection of altar on left. Ann being tied to altar. People crowding to top of wall. CUT TO exterior of wall, projection of altar on left. Ann being tied to altar. People crowding top of wall with torches. Two men begin beating big gong, those on wall yelling and beating drums. CUT TO Great Gate, natives closing and bracing it. Top of wall. Chief invoking Kong:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara Ta ni, Kong. O Taro Vey, Rama Kong.  (We call thee, Kong. O Mighty One, Great Kong.) Wa saba ani mako, O Taro Vey, Rama Kong. (The bride is here, O Mighty One, Great Kong.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO altar and jungle opening set, split shot. Noise suddenly stops. KONG steps from jungle opening, looks at people on wall, beats his chest. Sees Ann, starts toward CUT TO exterior of wall, projection of altar on left. Kon walks way from camera till he blocks altar from view. People on wall watch in silence. CUT TO close altar set, Ann and altar against projection background, cutting to double projection when Kong passes foreground. Kong in close up stands behind girl, looking at her. He l up at wall and beats his chest. He walks round altar, the starts to unfasten her. CUT TO straight shot of people on wall, breaking out in w demonstration as Kong takes Ann. CUT TO village street, Council House set, ship's party ra through and into court. CUT TO exterior wall set, Kong turns from Altar with Ann his hand and walks toward camera. Crowd on wall in uproar gong, drums, yelling, waving torches. CUT TO Driscoll and party reaching Gate, he hears Ann scr looks through window. CUT TO what he sees. Edge of Jungle set, miniature. KONG walks away from camera and into jungle, turning to l back, so Ann is seen in his hand. CUT TO Great Gate. Driscoll wildly gesturing to sailors t open it. Noise continues. Sailors struggle with pole. They get it down and start tugging at gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got Ann! Who's coming with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Here you - and you - (selecting sailors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brushing him aside) Skipper, you stay here with half the men and guard this gate. Don't let 'em close it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got the bombs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy comes forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you fellers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll, Denham and eleven sailors start through gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts back) Keep the gate open for us, Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN to follow the men, headed by Driscoll and Denham as t plunge through the jungle; left to right. (NOTE: This alo top of ledge-crevasse set, not showing edge.)

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: CRANE TO FOLLOW as they come up the ledge. A twittering o birds and insects' noises. Ad lib as they come: "Watch th log" -- "Shove right on through." Men go left to right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops, wipes his forehead) No telling where he's gone in this darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came by here. Look at those broken branches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. He's up ahead somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks about) The sun ought to be rising about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to those birds. (bird noises) It's dawn all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to one of Kong's great footprints; just visible a first shaft of dawn light strikes down between the tree CRANE TO CLOSE. All move forward - TRUCK TO FOLLOW To look at Kong's footprint. Probably no close up necessa Ad lib murmurs together, "Get that" - "It's tracks" - "Lo here, Jo."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the size of that. He must be as big as a house. He's come this way, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's heading that way. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCK to LONGER SHOT as he leads them forward. All hasten after Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to sailors) Keep those guns cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's telling us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they exit, camera left - DISSOLVE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: As the men come from the edge of the jungle, last fringe shrubbery masking foreground, to look out upon an open gl They pause, as they see broken shrubbery. It is now full dawn. Use "Most Dangerous Game" ledge set, men coming tow camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. We're on his trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads them forward out into -

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The open glade. Kong's footsteps is visible in soft earth again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees footprints, points, shouts back without stopping) There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hurry forward in a dog trot. A couple of sailors, running, pass Driscoll, then stop, run back into the arms the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They point and all stop as they see -- An immense spike-tailed beast coming through the jungle parallel with them, partially masked by trees. Men in foreground here. (Williams Process)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great Scott, that's something I didn't know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an idea there's plenty on this island you weren't figuring on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast crashes out into the open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme one of those bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches a bomb from the sailor who is carrying them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast charges. The men run. Only Driscoll and Denham stand their ground. Driscoll fires several times without effect. This should be a very wide glade to get the full effect of a long charge.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The first angle at edge of glade, with Denham and Driscol the foreground, other men running back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gun empty) It won't stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denham throws his bomb.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Second angle again. The bomb strikes the beast, explodes. of the smoke, the two-horned beast staggers towards the t men. They throw themselves to either side.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: First angle. Driscoll and Denham throw themselves flat on ground as --

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: In the first angle, the beast collapses just short of the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its head is just short of Driscoll. It goes limp.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The sailors, huddled behind the shrubbery at the edge of wood (as in the first shot of this sequence) stare at --

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The beast, unconscious on the ground. In the foreground, Denham and Driscoll pick themselves up.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: FIRST ANGLE - the sailors run forward to --

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Join Driscoll and Denham. They start forward towards the beast. It is in the background. (Projection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. He's only knocked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a gun from one of the men and goes forward to th great beast's head. He shoots it through the ear. It's st convulsing, then grows rigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a look, speaks to Driscoll) I told you those gas bombs would bring down anything. We'll get that ape alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not trying to catch the ape - we're trying to save that girl. Come on - we're losing time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads them off towards --

dialogues.speaker: LAP DISSOLVE
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE IN on the exterior of a bank, leading, in the background down into a hollow filled with fog. The men co in from camera left and look down. (Fog Hollow set from " Dangerous Game")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following tracks with eyes) There's his foot again -- (following director) -- he's down in that hollow where the fog is, some place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks) There's water down there. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They listen. Sounds of splashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him, splashing through. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run down into fog. (CURTAIN EFFECT)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men run down the muddy bank through heavy fog towards water, left to right. (Fog Hollow set)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The water's edge, as the men run down through heavy fog l to right. A couple of fallen trees, floated down with the current, lie half submerged by the bank. Kong's footprint in the mud, Kong splashing out of stream on other side ca heard as men come up. (Fog Hollow Set)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at footprint, then across stream) He must have swum across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's out for us. We can't swim with guns and bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks about, sees log, gets an idea) How about these -- (indicates logs) -- for a raft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's it. A raft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, boys, gets busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some vines, Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim, the sailor to be used in tree, runs for vines. Other sailors run to logs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at log) Pull 'em clear now.

dialogues.speaker: LAP DISSOLVE
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE IN on the raft, now completed. They have bound t logs together with liana vines. Heavy fog. The arms and bombs are loaded on the raft. So are they me They last of them are just getting on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get the arms wet, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guarding them) I'm watching 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helping another on) Easy now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts, looking around) All set? All set, everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set. Let 'er go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shove off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of sailors; still on shore, push the raft out un they are waist deep, then jump aboard. Others use poles t push it towards the opposite bank. Ad lib, "Push -- put y back in it, etc."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raft moves across the stream through heavy fog. (Miniature raft and miniature men.)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: This shot moves through fog with men as they pole raft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy now -- keep her against the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your weight in the center, boys -- weight in the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops poling to stare) Holy mackerel -- look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All look.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A huge scaly head rears up from the water to look down on raft, drifting, horrible. It is the head of a Dinosaur. I this the raft can also be seen. (Miniature raft, miniatur beast.) Heavy fog. The men shriek in wild commotion.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The angle which moves with the raft as the men, yelling wildly, attempt to pole the raft towards the shore. One o two men are pushed off in the panic. Everyone shoves the wrong way. Heavy fog here.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Dinosaur dives and starts for the raft in a series of undulating, sea-serpent dives. Wild panic and shrieks on raft. Heavy fog. (Miniature raft, men and beast.)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The angle which moves with the raft. It has come to a standstill now as the men shove in the wrong directions, shouting at each other. Some are trying vainly to reach t arms. The head of the Dinosaur rears up from the water be the boat, upsetting; as he comes up under it, the raft wi its occupants. They fall, screaming, into the stream. Fog (Miniature projection)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Three sailors as they land in the water and come up screaming. A FLASH. Fog. Tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sailor drowning. Flash. Fog. Tank.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The sailor with the bombs starts to sink. He loosens the bombs and lets them go to the bottom. Fog. Tank.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Dinosaur thrashing among the men and the broken raft. Some swim for the shore. (Miniature raft, men and beast a before) Heavy Fog.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men run out of the water on the far bank. The beast c be heard behind them. They run up, left to right. Heavy f (Fog Hollow set, use bullrushes)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men run up another section of bank. Either away from camera or left to right. The beast can be heard behind th Fog. (Fog Hollow Set)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Another shot of the men running up the bank, away from ca or left to right, with the beast heard behind them. Fog. Hollow Set)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men run up the bank. One man (Tim) is in the rear. He sees the Dinosaur following through the fog (double print miniature) He runs toward the jungle - (tree not in this shot) Fog. (Fog Hollow Set)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men run out of the fog at the top of the bank. (Fog Hollow Set where they were seen entering fog, curtain eff Left to right movement, slightly head-on.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men run left to right, followed by the beast. Tim, th last man, runs towards and into the jungle, with the Dino after him. (Miniature man, miniature beast, projection on fog. (Most Dangerous Game set)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men climb a bank. (Most Dangerous Game Ledge set)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Tim runs up to the base of a tree, climbs it. (Real man, tree from Most Dangerous Game set)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men climb higher on the bank.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: They climb over the top of the bank. Shrubbery masks the foreground. In the background is seen an asphalt morass, backed by jungle. Driscoll in the lead here. Denham the l man. (Most Dangerous Game ledge set for the foreground, m and miniature for background). They hear the sound of the Dinosaur and the shrieks of the sailor they left behind. turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares) It's Tim he's after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All stare as they see --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Dinosaur approaches the sailor who has climbed to the tree top. He shrieks in terror. (Miniature man and tree)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men stare at this, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't anybody got a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each man looks at the next fellow, hoping he has saved a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all at the bottom of the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to sailor who carried bombs) Then gimme one of those bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to let them go to keep from drowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All stare back at tree as the doomed sailor's shrieks for help grow louder.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Dinosaur comes up to the man in the tree. (Miniature and tree)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The man in the tree shrieks. The Dinosaur's head comes in the shot, about to seize him. (Real man, real tree from M Dangerous Game, miniature projection background)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Dinosaur seizes the man. His cries cease abruptly as teeth crunch into him.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men at the top of the bank look sickened. They stare they see --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Dinosaur carries the sailor away into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: They turn away, lead by Denham, then stop as they see, ov the shrubbery, Kong retreating towards them with the girl from the jungle background into a mire which lies in the middle distance, masked by foreground shrubbery and backe jungle. (MATTE) This mire is an asphalt pit. In the center is a d mound to which Kong springs. He is pursued by two huge th horned beasts (tricerotops) who, trying to follow, find themselves mired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to men) Down! Down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All throw themselves down behind shrubbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we only had some of those bombs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MED. SHOT of men crouching behind shrubbery, as he speak this last line) A terrific fight now ensues between Kong and the three-ho beasts. Kong picks up boulders and hurls them down on the beasts as they try to reach him through the asphalt mire. kills two. The third retreats. During this, the men exit cautiously, camera right, and reappear in the background, camera right. (Matte) The thr horned beast sees them. He charges them. They run out, ca right, with the three-horned beast following.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: SIDE ANGLE - PAN to follow men as they run, left to right

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men to run to camera. No beast in this shot.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE as they run away from camera. A low-hanging branch bars their way. They run under it. The sailor with striped trousers is last. He turns to look back at the be whose noise behind them can be heard, and strikes his hea against the branch. He falls, picks himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he picks himself up, holding head, dazed) Boys - boys, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up into camera, first dazed, then, as his head clears, he sees the beast charging. He shrieks and runs o camera right.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SHOT
dialogues.text: The old shot from Creation. The striped-trousers sailor r through the woods, followed by the three-horned beast. He seeks refuge behind a tree. The beast knocks over the tre It falls upon the sailor, pinning him down. The beast gor him to death.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The remaining men run towards a deep ravine, across which huge tree has fallen. Ravine is background. Kong is cross this log with the girl, right to left. Men run in left to right. They stop at seeing Kong, then turn back to see --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: SHOT looking away from ravine, over men's heads. Men in foreground. In the background may be seen entering a huge horned beast, (Arsinotherium). He is rooting in the groun He lifts his head, sniffs, smelling the men. He begins to lumber towards them with gathering speed. They run out, l to right.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men run in from left to right, led by Driscoll. He wa them on. In the foreground is a huge tree. In the backgro is the big fallen tree across the ravine. He passes this to camera right, and reappears from camera right crossing log. The men follow, shouting.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong comes into a clearing, in the foreground of which is high dead tree. He hears the shouts of the men behind.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: He puts the girl down in the top of the dead tree, snarls and turns back to attack the men.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: He goes back to attack the men, leaving the girl in the t of the dead tree.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong goes back along the pool towards the ravine.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll enters from camera left, waves the men on. In th shot, the log is seen in the background, extending across ravine. In the foreground is a huge tree. The men follow Driscoll about this tree to camera right and reappear on log, entering from camera left. They start across it.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The log itself is seen, with the men crossing it from cam right and going towards the other side of the ravine, Driscoll in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE as the men cross in the foreground, where t end of the log lies on the far side of the ravine. The me come off this end of the log onto the bank, in foreground faces camera. In the background, Denham can be seen. He i the last man and is about to cross when suddenly he sees something and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Original angle with the men coming off log on the far sid the ravine. Kong appears from camera right to menace them

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong snarls at them.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE as Denham sees this and ducks back into the shrubbery out of sight. The men in the foreground also se Kong and run back across the log. Driscoll climbs over ba in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The log itself as the men run back across it, stumbling a falling, only to be stopped by --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: -- the two horned beast, who is coming up to the log, whi is in the foreground, from camera left background. REVERS ANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The top of the far bank, as the last of the men rush acro the log. Driscoll climbs down over the bank, using a vine support. (Note. This angle may not be necessary now).

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll comes down on the vine along the side of the ban and steps into a cave in the side of the bank some ten fe below the top. He looks to see --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men running back on the log, towards the camera, with ape coming up to the log on the far bank, menacing them. the original angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong menaces them.  His face leaps up into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
