dialogues.text: The sailor in the black sweater, on the log, horrified as sees this.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The log itself, no beasts in the shot. The men see the ho beast off screen and retreat only to be stopped by Kong o screen.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll in the cave sees this, holding to a vine. He continues to look up, watching --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men, in the original angle, as Kong in the background heaves up the far end of the log.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men on the log, terrified, as Kong rocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong roaring at them.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men on the log with Kong shaking it, from the origina angle. Two fall off.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men fall to the bottom of the ravine.  It is very dee with mud and slime at the bottom. Caves and fissures in t rock lie at the sides of this mud.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men land in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men on the log, as Kong rocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong roars at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sailor stares at Kong and screams in stark terror.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: SIDE ANGLE of the log with the men clinging to it as Kong shakes it. The two horned beast can be seen menacing them from his bank with his horns. Another sailor falls off.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The sailor falls into the ravine bottom.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: He lands in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: From the original angle, Kong is seen rocking the log.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The log with men clinging to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong roars at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men, on the log, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: From the original angle, Kong rocks the log with men on i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men on the log. One tries to hold himself from fallin clutching another's face.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Suggest here a SHOT of Denham watching from his shrubbery horrified, so as not to lose him. REVERSE ANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: From side angle, the men are seen clinging to the log, wh the ape rocks it and the horned beast menaces them from t other side. More men fall.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men fall to the ravine bottom.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: They land in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong roars at the men and beats chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the sailors on the log shrieks in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong's face rushes up into the camera as he reaches for a man.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong, from the original angle, reaches for the men remain on the log, trying to seize them with his hand. The man h reaches for drops flat, ducking his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong roars at them.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong, from the original angle, rocks the log. A man falls off.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The man falls to the ravine bottom.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: He lands in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The man on the log, only one remains - clinging as the lo rocked by Kong, off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: From the original angle, Kong is seen trying to shake the last man off the log.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The last man hanging to the log desperately.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The SIDE ANGLE with the last man hanging to the log. Kong lifts the log and drops it into the ravine. No horned bea here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The log and the man fall to the ravine bottom.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: They land in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong on the bank yammers down at the men who have fallen. Driscoll can be seen in the cave below.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men at the bottom of the ravine are attacked by giant insects who come out of caves and fissures to eat them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surprised face of a sailor lying in the mud as he see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face of another sailor staring up in horror from the mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face of a third sailor in the mud, horrified as he sees -

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: An insect with octopus arms takes a man. (Projection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its arms wind around the struggling man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men on their backs staring up at a spider who attacks them. (Projection).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The face of a fourth sailor, fallen in mud, staring in ho as he sees --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A giant lizard takes a man.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong on the bank senses Driscoll's presence in the cave below. PAN down to the cave with Driscoll. He looks up, warily watching for Kong above. Continued to PAN DOWN revealing a huge spider climbing up on a vine from the ra bottom to the cave.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll in his cave notices the vine shake. He looks dow see --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The spider coming up the vine. (Previous angle)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll whips out his knife and starts cutting the vine.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll cuts the line just in time to prevent the spider reaching him. The giant insect falls to the ravine bottom PAN UP to Kong again. He reaches in the cave trying to ge Driscoll.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll eludes the hand, stabbing at it.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Denham watching from his shrubbery on the far side. REVER ANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong tries to reach Driscoll who backs about the cave, stabbing with his knife.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll succeeds in stabbing Kong's hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong pulls back his hand, licks it, snarling angrily.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ann, on the dead tree top, awakens from her faint. She lo about dazed. She looks down to see --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A snake crawling along beside the tree - VERTICAL SHOT fr her angle.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ann gasps in terror.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong is still trying to reach Driscoll in the cave.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A giant meat-eater enters the glade. Girl on tree-top in foreground. It sees her, comes toward her.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A man-eater, in the background, comes toward Ann on the t top in the foreground. She shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong, reaching for Driscoll in the cave, is just about to him when he hears Ann's screams.  He starts back at once towards her.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong comes back along the side of a pool, which lies in t foreground of the scene, jungle in the background. He has from camera left and out camera right to -

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The clearing with the dead tree. The terrified girl is in tree, foreground. The meat-eater in the background turns he hears Kong off screen from camera left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong enters from camera left. The meat-eater advances to him from camera left. The tree with the girl is in the mi distance. This shot is masked by foreground trees.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong and the meat-eater fight. Ann on her tree-top is in foreground, animals in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong is knocked down by the meat-eaters tail. The meat-ea attacks him as he lies sprawled on his back. Kong manages get to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The ape and the meat-eater fight. Ann on the tree-top in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong dodges back and out of the scene to camera left as t meat-eater leaps from camera right. The girl on the dead in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The animals fight, moving into this shot from camera left Ann on her tree top in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong backs into this shot from camera left. The meat-eate follows to attack. They fight. Kong gets a grip on the me eater's hind foot and throws him. Both wheel around as th fall. The meat-eater falls on camera right, Kong on camer left. Kong leaps on the meat-eater as he lies on his back Girl on tree in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong falls. Ann on the tree top in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meat-eater, still on his back, kicks Kong out to came left. Ann on tree in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meat-eater springs up and menaces Kong, who is out of shot, off camera left. Girl on tree in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong, on his feet, beats his chest in defiance. Girl in foreground on tree top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong leaps in and grabs the meat-eater's front foot. Girl foreground on tree top.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong shifts his hold on the front leg to a head hold, thr the meat-eater over his head. Girl on tree top in foregro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong throws the meat-eater. The meat-eater gets up. Kong grapples with him again. The meat-eater throws Kong back against the tree with the girl in foreground. This is a n angle, tree center foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ann on the tree top as Kong backs into it.  She screams a the tree, jarred by the tremendous impact, starts to fall TILT DOWN as tree falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tree falls, with the screaming girl, pinning her unde it. Kong falls also. This is the new angle.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The girl on the ground pinned by the tree, which half cov her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beasts fighting, with the girl under the tree in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The fight continues, with the girl under the tree in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beasts fighting. Girl under the tree in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The girl, under the tree, looks in horror at this spectac REVERSE ANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beasts fight. Ann under the tree in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE again of the girl watching, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animals fight. Kong grabs the meat-eater's head, bite and twists. The meat-eater falls, then gets up. Kong leap his back, grabs his mouth, trying to pry open jaws. Ann u tree in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong grabs the meat-eater's jaws, pries them open.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The girl, under the tree, staring, horrified. REVERSE ANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong, on the meat-eater's back, pulls open its jaws. Girl foreground under tree. Kong pulls back, so that he pulls meat-eater over. He falls with it, gets up, grabs his jaw again. The meat-eater lies prostrate as he works on it.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong's hands break the jaw. Ann under tree in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong sees he has broken the meat-eater's jaw. He gives it waggle to make sure, see it is dead, then rises and pound his chest with a triumphant roar. He starts over towards girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong's face as he looks down at Ann, interested and pleas

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The girl under the tree. She screams as she sees Kong loo down at her. This shot from Kong's angle. TRUCK DOWN to MEDIUM SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong takes hold of the log. Ann screams.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kong's hand lifts up the tree, freeing Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong picks up Ann.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ann, as she is lifted by Kong's hand. His shoulder is in foreground. REVERSE ANGLE. She looks fearfully up at him. This from h angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong as he looks down at her, interested.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The girl held in his hand - shoulder out of shot now. REV ANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong goes off with her to Camera right.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Denham raises himself cautiously from the shrubbery. He l to see --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: -- the Stegasaurus disappearing in the direction from whi he first appeared.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Denham, reassured, moves forward to --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: --the edge of the ravine by the big log. He looks down horrified at what he sees, then across. He is startled to

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: --from his angle, Driscoll rises from the bottom of what seemed a quite empty cave. Driscoll does not at first see Denham. He too looks down to the bottom of the ravine, th starts to climb up the vines to the top of the ravine abo the cave.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Denham's impulse is to call to him, but caution asserts itself. He checks himself, looks carefully behind him, th back, to see.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: --Driscoll, from his angle, climbing up to the top of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls, as softly as possible) Jack - Jack Driscoll.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll, turns, looks startled as he sees Denham in the background.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: --Denham on the far side. Driscoll in the foreground of t SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- Jack.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ANGLE
dialogues.text: Shooting into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) It didn't get you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to cover, same as you. (looking around apprehensively) I guess we're safe now.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll in foreground, Denham in background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe like a cow in the stockyards. (glances down ravine) There's only two of us left alive, to save that girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get across now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to. You got to lam back for some more of them bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't follow that beast alone?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: To get fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's got to keep on his trail while it's hot. Maybe I'll get a chance to snake her away -- and if I don't I'll figure some way to signal your party where he's taken her.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll in foreground, Denham in background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's the only out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it is. Get going now -- and don't get croaked till you give the office to Englehorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts into shrubbery - waves back) O.K., Jack. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later...maybe (exits camera left)

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll plunges into the jungle after Kong. The parrot flutters after him. He crosses by the pool.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Driscoll comes out to the clearing with the tree. The dea meat-eater lies there. Vultures are feeding on him. Drisc looks at this. A distant crashing sounds in the woods. He listens and realizes it is Kong crashing through the jung carrying the girl. Driscoll starts after him.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Denham makes his way through the jungle, left to right, P TO FOLLOW, on his way back to the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong crosses foreground of a big shot with mountain and c in background. Boy pursues on the run.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATION
dialogues.text: Driscoll runs through the pool and waterfall set after Ko

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATION
dialogues.text: Kong comes from the jungle and starts up the base of a cl (Deadfall set of Most Dangerous Game.) Driscoll runs out the jungle and starts up the cliff after Kong.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE IN as Kong climbs to a ledge from which a great fissure in the rock opens into the mountains. He is unaware that the boy is following him. He enters th fissure with the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great black pool lies at camera right. Entrance as at b It has an outlet through the rock through which the water pours out in a waterfall. Steep walls of rock rise to an immense height all around. A trail leads up camera left t ledge high above. This ledge looks out upon an opening through which daylight pours. It is this daylight which faintly illuminates the subterranean depths below. Kong enters with the girl, passes along the camera left side o the pool towards the trail. The head of the monster rears out the pool. He stares at Kong, who can be seen starting up the path which leads towards the ledge above. The monster lunges for the shore starts to glide up the trail after Kong. Driscoll enters in the background and at once dunks behin rock. Kong places the girl on a small ledge beside the trail to lair. He plunges down over the side of his lair, with a r to attack the sea monster. Eve Ann is in the foreground o this shot, on the ledge. Instantly, the water monster winds himself about Kong and draws him toward the pool. Kong fights to keep himself from being drawn into the poo the monster, whose tail has a purchase in the bottom of t water somewhere. He grips rocks with his feet, locks his great arms about the monster, crushing him, sinking his t into the monster's body. The monster in turn winds his co about the great ape trying to crush him. After a few mome of frantic struggle, accompanied by hideous noises, both lapse into low grunts and hisses as each exerts strength against the other. It is a question of which will be crushed first. Driscoll the foreground or background of this shot. As the monster locked in a death embrace, grow still, hardly moving at a FADE OUT. FADE IN. THE GREAT GATE - NIGHT - Sailors on guard. Englehorn, 2nd Mate and others in group round Denham who sitting on the ground, torn, dishevelled, still panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Skipper, I tell you this Kong is the biggest thing on earth.  He shook the men off that log like flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those men lost! Incredible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll said he'd try to signal us when he found Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groans) We'll never see either of them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give up, Skipper. There's still a chance for Driscoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to wait for daylight. Then we'll bridge the ravine. Where's that other case of bombs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This--this monster that you saw, will he care for bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can get near enough to use 'em, you bet he'll care. Had any trouble with the natives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, just after you left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fired a couple volleys over their heads, and they took to their huts like scared rabbits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunpowder's something new in their lives, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've kept under cover ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to 2nd Mate) Briggs, get up on the wall and keep your eyes peeled. We'll start at dawn, whether we get a signal for Driscoll or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE IN on the interior of the cavern. Kong and the w monster are still locked in each other's arms at the edge the pool. Driscoll is in the foreground behind a rock. Ko manages to exert a last pressure of arms and teeth. The w monster suddenly gives a snakey cry of agony and goes lim His coils relax. His head falls back. Kong realizes he is dead and extricates himself. He is very tired. He stagger towards the trail, takes the girl from the ledge and asce to his lair once more. Driscoll comes out from behind his rock to watch this.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong takes the girl up into his lair, shooting towards la

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: This lair opens out upon the mountain side at a great hei The opening is the eye of the legendary Skull after which island is named. This shot looking from the opening into lair as Kong brings the girl up into the lair from the tr (Miniature and matte.) He goes to:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: --the ledge outside the opening, overlooking the island. SHOT. He sets her down. Then he towers over her, silhouet against the rising moon, he gives a triumphant roar. He b his chest, defying the world outside. Ann shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll hears her cry and starts cautiously up the trail the lair.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Now Kong, in the side angle, squats and takes up the girl his great hand. She tries to run away. He lets her run to edge of the trail, then catches her and pulls her back, a cat might play with a mouse. Repeat this action.  The sec time, he takes her up in his hand and stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong stares at the girl with a puzzled, interested expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl in his hand looks back at him, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong, in side angle, begins to pick her clothes off, as a monkey might pick a rag doll to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ann shrinks and screams as her clothes are pulled off bit bit.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Driscoll comes up the trail. He can hear the girl's screa He hurries.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The girl is almost naked. SIDE ANGLE. Kong is still picki at her when he turns startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong looks alert and startled toward the trail.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong puts the girl down and goes to look over the edge of trail. SIDE ANGLE. The girl at once retreats to the edge the outer edge of the lair, the lair which overlooks the landscape without.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong looks down upon the trail from the lair above, this cavern in train set, shooting into Kong's face and the bo back. Driscoll can be seen below Kong, flattening himself into a crevice in the rocks. Kong looks down, trying to s him, much puzzled over the source of the noise.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: This shot from outside looking in. The girl looks terrifi as she sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant meat-eating bird (petrodactyl) high above her, wheeling. Girl in foreground here.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: This shot taken with bird in foreground, ZOOMING down tow girl, seen on lair far below, as the bird dives. CAMERA Z with bird.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ann screams as the bird seizes her. SIDE ANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong, peering down the trail, hears noise and turns to ru back. Boy in foreground.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: He catches the bird out of the air just as it starts to f away with the girl. A terrific fight between the two. The girl runs back towards the trail. SIDE ANGLE here.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Driscoll comes up over the edge of the lair as the girl r in. Shot from looking outside looking in. He sees the gir He rushes to seize her. He tries to rush her back towards trail. As he does do, Kong finishes wringing the bird's n and turns to see the intruder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong's face as he sees Driscoll with the girl and roars angrily.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Shot from outside looking in. Kong starts toward them.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Driscoll takes the only means of escape possible. He is o the inner edge of the lair, overlooking the subterranean pool. Seizing the girl about the waist, he dives off with her, just in time to avoid Kong's grasp.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: They land in the pool and come up. This a shot of surface pool.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong rushes down the trail after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong, at the edge of the pool. He tries to reach them as swim towards the orifice.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: His great hand just misses them in the water. They dive. reaches for them again.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER SHOT as his hand tries to seize them.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (MINIATURE)
dialogues.text: The subterranean outlet, through which the water of the p pours out in a waterfall to the mountain side without. Th comes up just in time to be sucked through it. (Miniature figure)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (MINIATURE)
dialogues.text: They are seen going over the waterfall as it pours out of mountain. They are swept down the torrents below. (Miniat figures)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong roars furiously. He rushes out through the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The boy and girl are swept down rapids.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong comes out of the fissure and starts down the edge of cliff.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Driscoll pulls the girl ashore. He helps her out, support her. They disappear into the jungle. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: --on Englehorn's party grouped about the inner side of th great gate. It is closed. The ship's party have lit a bonfire, about which there are grouped with their arms, including Denham and Englehorn. At the top of the wall, sailors are standing watch.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: One of the sailors at the top of the wall suddenly grabs arm of another and points as he sees Driscoll and Ann com out of the woods. They are visible in the background. (Do print silhouettes.) They look to see --

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: -- Driscoll and Ann, from their angle, as they come from jungle Driscoll is carrying the girl. (This using set of Kong's original entrance.)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The sailor who saw this calls down to those below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts down) Driscoll and the lady -- coming up from the woods, sir.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A commotion at the foot of the wall. All spring to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gott sei dank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll and Ann - as the rescue party runs up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her to me. (takes the girl from Driscoll)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grasping Driscoll's hand) Good man, Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll almost collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half supporting him, pulls flask from his pocket) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll takes it, staggers over to Ann. She is lying on ground, Denham kneeling beside her. Driscoll bends over h gives her a drink.  She chokes over it, pushes it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right. Oh Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hides her face against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, now. You're safe. We'll be back on the ship in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll is kneeling, holding Ann in his arms. Denham get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. What about Kong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came here to make a moving picture, but we've found something worth all the movies in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't believe his ears) What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got the bombs. If we capture him alive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. Anyway, he's on top of a cliff where an army couldn't get at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he chooses to stay there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got something he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Ann. She shrinks in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furiously) Something he won't get again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar of KONG is heard in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's followed us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann screams, Driscoll puts arms round her.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong bursts from the jungle. Sees them and beats his brea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All run for the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This SHOT shooting towards village street, as native warriors, alarmed at sound of Kong - which can be heard - come running towards gate with weapons in hand.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The sailors at the gate hear the natives running up behin them and snatch up weapons, ready to defend themselves. T natives, however, run up, holding their hands, with weapo above their heads, to show no harm is meant, shouting "KO KONG," and indicating with gestures that the gate must be closed. Some start to pick up the big pole used to keep t gate shut. Before the sailors have time to ask questions, another frightful roar and drumming is heard beyond the w

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE as Kong, in the foreground, pursues the peo in the background. (Using Most Dangerous Game jungle glas

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The party who went to meet the boy and girl, with boy and girl, run through the gate, past natives and sailors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Shut the gate - shut the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands on the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blows whistle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll runs straight on out of the shot, with Ann, towa village square. The sailors drop their weapons to push th gate closed. The native warriors, who picked up the big p now push it against the gate - some sixty of them on it. few others stand by with weapons - leaders, evidently - shouting orders and encouragements.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE - Kong, in the foreground, pursues the peop in the background. (Using Most Dangerous Game jungle glas

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong reaches the gate and gets his foot jammed in it as i closes. (Miniature)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The ship's party tries to force the gate shut. Kong gets arm through it.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The arm lifts a sailor and crushes him or beats him again the gate.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Sailors at the bottom press against the gate frantically keep Kong out. Kong's foot can be seen blocking the gate.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The great hand drops the sailor, dead.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: He falls among the sailors at the bottom of the gate, as strain keep Kong out.  Kong's foot in the shot.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong throws himself repeatedly against the gate. It begin wrench loose.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The sailors press against the gate. They look up, horrifi as they see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the hinges above tearing loose.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: They redouble their efforts to keep the gate shut.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong makes one last lunge at the gate. It rips loose from hinges --

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: -- and falls in. The sixty natives on the long pole are crushed. The sailors run for their lives. They have no ti to pick up weapons. The few surviving natives with spears the one's nor on pole - also run. Kong stands in the gate snarling, beating his chest. He starts after them. Village street, sailors panicking through, taking refuge huts. Driscoll and Ann run across, behind huts. Denham runs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bombs! Who's got the bombs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KONG advances down street, towering over huts. He roars a knocks huts aside. Men in foreground run. KONG tears roof off a hut. Interior Hut from Kong's angle. Men cowering in a corner. They look up at camera and shriek. KONG reaches into hut, picks up a native. Exterior, behind a hut. Driscoll, half-carrying Ann. Stop looks back, hurries her out. KONG looks at native in his hand, throws him aside. Denham runs past after some sailors, one of them carrying bombs. KONG knocking down more huts. Driscoll and Ann running, trying to keep behind huts. KONG sees them over roofs. Close-up of KONG snarling as he sees: Long shot, Driscoll Ann clear of village and running for beach. KONG starts after them. The beach, boats drawn up. Sailors running. Denham overtakes them, grabs man with bombs, pulls him around. Man tries to run. Denham hits him, seizes bombs. Driscoll and Ann running toward camera. KONG pursuing. Denham steps forward, throws bombs over Driscoll's head. Bombs burst in front of KONG. Smoke veils him. KONG staggers forward through smoke, coughing. He knocks Denham aside with his hand. He reaches for Driscoll and Ann, and pitches forward. CLOSE SHOT, Driscoll and Ann. KONG'S reaching hand falls this shot, and he's limp. Village street. Night. Englehorn and Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets up, pushes Englehorn aside) Come on. We've got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Village street. Night. KONG's great side, heaving as he breathes. All crowd around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exultant) He'll be out for hours. Send off to the ship for anchor-chain, Skipper. And tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Build a raft to float him out to the ship. The whole world'll pay to see this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chains will hold -- that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll give him more than chains. He's always been king of the world. But we'll teach him fear. (his voice rises triumphantly) We're millionaires. I'll share with all of you. Listen, boys a few months from now it'll be in lights on Broadway -- Kong, the Eight Wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO electric sign on a theatre, "KONG, the Eight Wonder." Tilt down to crowds outside. CLOSEUPS of crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say it's sort of a gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, ain't we got enough of them in New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another close-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his girl) I hear it's bigger'n an elephant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chewing gum) Does it do tricks or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another close-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in evening dress) Heavens, what a mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you would come. And the tickets cost me twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long Shot of crowd, zoom forward over their heads toward entrance. Dissolve to wings of theatre, shoot toward stage. Ann and Driscoll in foreground, peering toward stage. Ann evening dress. Driscoll dinner jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to look at him, Jack. It makes me feel the way I did that awful day on the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have brought you, but you know how Denham insisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we had to come when he said it would help the show. Do you suppose we'll really make a lot of money, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fussing with his collar) Enough to pay him back for these clothes, anyway...I never had an open-face suit before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denham bustles in. Full evening dress, silk hat, gardenia is excited and important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, you're just on time. You look great, Ann. Glad I dressed you up for this show. Hello, Jack. Ten thousand dollars in the box office. How's that for one night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say! That's money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we're going to do that every night. The newspaper boys are coming in now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Group of reporters and photographers come in to Ann, Driscoll, and Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Darrow, boys. And Mr. Driscoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Mr. Driscoll rescued you from the ape, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He was alone. All the sailors with him had been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking off-stage) Alone, eh? Whew! How did you tackle that baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Denham's the one that got him. The rest of us were running like rabbits, but Denham had the nerve to stand still and chuck gas-bombs at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporters turn to Denham, saying "Oh, you're the hero "Come on spill it," etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, lay off me. Miss Darrow is the story. If it hadn't been for her, we'd never have got near KONG. He came back to the village for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty and the Beast, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Play up that angle. Beauty and the Beast. KONG could have stayed safe where we'd never have got him, but he couldn't stay away from Beauty. That's your story, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a story all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a few pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I want you to take flashlights on the stage in front of the audience. We'll ring the curtain up now, and I'll make a speech. Tell 'em about KONG and Miss Darrow and Driscoll. Then when I call you, you all come on and take pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographers ad lib. "Sure," "We'll do that," etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Ann. I want you and Jack there when the curtain goes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrinking) Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. We've knocked some of the fight out of him since you saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He urges Ann off. Driscoll follows. Cut to back of theatre, looking toward stage, curtain dow House packed. Denham comes before the curtain. In almost tones of the circus spieler, he begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I am here tonight to tell you a strange story. So strange a story that no one will believe it. But, ladies and gentlemen, seeing is believing, and we -- I and my partners -- have brought back the living proof of our adventure, an adventure in which twelve of our party met terrible deaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to wings of theatre. Reporters and photographers look onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy smoke, look at that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope he's tied up good and plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure he is. Denham's taking no chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut to front of theatre. Denham addressing audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and now, ladies and gentlemen, before I tell you more, I am going to show you the greatest sight your eyes ever beheld. He was the king and the god of the world he knew, but now he comes to civilization, merely a captive, a show to gratify your curiosity. Ladies and gentlemen, look at KONG, the Eight Wonder of the World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtain rises to disclose a raised platform, on which KONG, loaded with chains and so fastened that he can move nothing but his head. Murmurs and exclamations from the audience, a few rise to their feet to get a better look. CUT TO medium shot on stage. Denham takes Ann's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to introduce Miss Ann Darrow. The pluckiest girl I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audience applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There the Beast, and here the Beauty. She has lived through an experience that no other woman ever dreamed of. And she was rescued from the very grasp of KONG by her future husband. I want you to meet a very brave gentleman, Mr. John Driscoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audience applauds. Driscoll bows awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, before I tell you the full story of our voyage. I am going to ask the gentlemen of the press to come forward, so that the audience may have the privilege of seeing them take the first photographs of KONG and his captors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks off-stage and beckons. The press men come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Darrow first, alone. Stand in front of KONG, Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann reluctantly does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it - That's near enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready. Hold it. Smile, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlights go off. KONG roars. Ann looks round in terror, with a startled cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be alarmed, ladies and gentlemen. Those chains are made of chrome steel. He can't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlights again. KONG roars and strains at chains. Ann covers her face. Driscoll steps forward to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them together, boys. They're going to be married tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your arm around her, Driscoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll does so. Flashlights. KONG roars, struggles. Ann hides her face against Driscoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Hold on. He thinks you're attacking the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him roar. Swell picture. (to flashlight men) Get this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlights again. With a frightful roar, KONG breaks his chains. Everyone stands paralyzed, as KONG beats his chest, roari The Driscoll grabs Ann, and rushes for door. The theatre; reporters, attendants running for safety. Audience in panic. KONG roaring. Driscoll and Ann through door. KONG starts across arena. Driscoll and Ann in street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hotel! Across the street!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run. KONG pushes down big door. Crowded street seen beyond him He plunges through. KONG comes up to hotel. Door is too small for him. He pee through big window. Driscoll and Ann in elevator going up. She is clinging to in panic. KONG outside hotel. A woman, several stories above, looks out window, sees KO screams. KONG looks up, sees woman, thinks it is Ann, sta to climb. Woman sees him coming, goes back from window. KONG climbing up building. A room in hotel, five men playing poker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeten it - sweeten it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all ante, while 2nd Man deals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all the doings over there at the theatre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a three-alarm fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, some movie stunt about a monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the theatre's sold out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This town sure is full of hicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KONG appears at window. They panic. Another room in hotel. Ann and Driscoll rush in, he slams door. Ann clings to him for a moment, then collapses on b gasping and sobbing. He kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush, Ann. Hush, darling. It's all right. You're safe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KONG climbing building. Another hotel room. A woman in negligee at telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Jimmy, it's Mabel - I been waiting for you to call up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howya, kid. Glad I'm back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet I'm glad you're back...I got your postal. Talk louder, Jimmy, there's fire-engines going by. I can't hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna step out with me, kid? Ya save the evening like I told ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I saved the evening...Nine o'clock'll be swell...And say, wait until you see my new outfit...All right, I'll be there...Say, when did I ever break a date with you, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsa matter? Hey, kid, what yer yelling -- Mabel! Mabel! Operator, something's happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KONG at window. He reaches in, picks her up, pulls her ou window. Exterior, hotel wall. KONG looks at her, sees she isn't A drops her disgustedly. Driscoll's hotel room. Ann sitting on bed. Driscoll kneel beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stay here, dear. I won't leave you. They'll get him. It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) It's a like a horrible dream. It's like -- being back there -- on the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll puts his arms round her, murmurs soothingly. KONG appears in window. Driscoll starts up. Ann turns and sees, shrieks, cowers o bed. KONG smashes window, his hand comes in, reaching. Driscol picks up a chair and attacks hand. KONG'S hand knocks him across room, where he lies sensele KONG'S hand drags the bed to the window, picks up Ann, ta her out window. Driscoll staggers to window, looks up after KONG, turns a rushes out. (Changes - 9/6/32) Hotel corridor. Denham running toward camera, followed by eyed bell-boys, clerks and waiter. Door to Driscoll's room opens, and Driscoll staggers out, almost colliding with Denham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! He's climbing up, outside there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got Ann. He's taking her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof! Quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush off. CUT TO roof of hotel. Denham and Driscoll run in. They se KONG, holding Ann, going over another roof. He goes out o sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to go) Fire Department searchlights. They'll keep him in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO - motorcycle cops. Crowd pointing and shouting. Policeman turning in alarm. Hook and ladder. KONG climbing. Cornice breaks. Cornice crashes on man. Firehouse, searchlights coming out. Siren. Mounted police ride out. Crowd in street. Searchlights on roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may have fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searchlight settles on Kong on distant roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! There he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still got the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another searchlight picks up Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's turned. He's going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police station, cops run out with guns. Wall of windows, full of heads, craning. Cop telephoning from street-box. Roof with searchlight. Kong not seen. Light moves to and looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two policemen enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Lost sight of him half and hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowd in street. Two men looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say he's disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what could he hide in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I hope he don't come down in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police Station. Sergeant at desk with phone. Denham and Driscoll pacing the floor. Phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes? Yes...No, not yet...Headquarters is broadcasting the reports. (he hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong, the giant ape, is still at large. He has not been seen since midnight. The whole city is aroused. We are hoping for a report at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll sits down with a groan and puts his head in his hands. Denham rests a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snap out of it, Jack. They're bound to find him when morning comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do anything. Ann's out there -- somewhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're pretty sure he won't hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may have dropped her. She may be lying somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention, all stations! Kong has been seen again. He is on the roofs of the warehouses at 41st Street. He is going toward the East River. He is still carrying Ann Darrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driscoll leaps up, clutching Denham. Phone on desk rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering it) Yes?...Yes, the report just come in...I don't know. What can we do without killing the girl, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he puts Ann down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) It'll be daylight in an hour. Keep him in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong is going West. He is making for the Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sergeant) If he goes up there, what can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't be able to get near him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong is climbing the Empire State. He is still carrying Ann Darrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's licked us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one thing that hasn't been tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airplanes. If he should put Ann down -- if they could fly near enough to pick him off -- without hitting Ann --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right! Planes -- as soon as it's daylight -- (he turns to phone and starts to call)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO planes taking off. Crowd in street, gazing up. Kong on top of Empire State. He puts Ann down and beats h chest. An airplane squadron, flying in formation. The planes over New York. Pilot looks over side, gives si to rest of squadron. Entrance to Empire State, crowd around doors, police hold them back. Denham, Driscoll, with two policemen, push the way through crowd. They pause in door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes the planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can they shoot him and not hit Ann? (he starts inside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Don't you get on that roof too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give the pilots a chance, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all exit into building. Top of Empire State. Dawn. Kong turns and looks up at a plane, roars and beats his chest. In plane, shot over pilot's shoulder, as plane dives at K Top of Empire State. Kong snatches at plane and drops it street. In the street, plane drops and burns. Top of Empire State. Kong roars and beats his chest. In 2nd plane, observer taps pilot and points. They dive. Top of Empire State. Plane banks around Kong, firing mach gun. Close shot of Kong - he is hit by bullets, staggers. Shot of Ann on ledge. Another plane zooms past, firing at Kong. Close shot of Kong, hit again. He coughs, looks down at h wounds. Looks at Ann, reaches as though to pick her up. Top of Empire State. More planes zoom down. Kong stands erect, drumming on his chest. The planes sweep by, firing staggers, turns slowly, and topples off roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire engines, searchlight units, police cars, motorcycles what not, speeding through crowded streets with sirens blowing. This would be particularly effective in some wel recognized location such as Times Square.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kong, carrying the girl, runs across roofs to the edge of city street. He leaps across the street, or alley, if the distance is too great, and catches a window of a building the opposite side. He pulls himself up and continues the chase. Crowds can be seen below.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Confusion in the street below this building as the crowds police, firemen, etc., rush after Kong.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE IN on an armed party, including Driscoll and pol officer, as they rush across roof tops and stop bewildere they see no trace of Kong. The first streaks of dawn are tinging the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use. All night we've been after him -- and never got near enough to take a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be daylight soon. That ought to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help the ape, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he goes -- making for the Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kong with the girl seen in the distance, going across roofs toward Empire State Building background. Probably n men needed in this shot, as building gives size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he takes the girl up there with him, we're fair beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. We can't shoot him down while he has the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. There's one thing we haven't tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air planes. The army planes from Roosevelt Field. They might find a way to pick him off without touching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. (to Lieutenant) Get to a phone, Tim. Call the field, - burn up the wires -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move away, DISSOLVE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE IN on the Empire State Building, as Kong climbs with the girl. The first streaks of Dawn light the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Military planes as they take off from an airport.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The dome of the Empire State Building as Kong climbs up.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The crowd in the street, watching this aghast. There are police cars, motorcycles, fire engines, and two of three searchlight units, keeping their lights fixed on him. Pol are keeping the crowd back. VERTICAL SHOT DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Kong climbs to stand on the dome, holding the girl. He be his chest, defying the whole civilized world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airplane squadron over New York, flying toward the Emp State Building. If desirable, this can be done without ci below, just against sky backing. The planes are pursuit ships.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The squadron leader looking over the side of the plane. H waves a signal to the other and dives.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The leader dives toward the Empire State Building, seen f below, Kong is just a dot on the roof. The rest continue fly in formation.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Kong hears the planes. He turns to look as the squadron leader banks about the top of the building, making a reconnaissance. Kong puts the girl down and suddenly reac out, snatches the plane out of the air. He crumples it an hurls it to --

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: -- the street below. It lands just short of the crowd and bursts into flames.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Kong again roars angry defiance at the world.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The observer of a 2nd plane taps the pilot's back, indica here's their chance. The military pilot of the second airplane fires machine gun as he dives. (NOTE: A LONG SHOT of Kong in dome from angle of plane wo it it's possible, help observer get this over. Maybe ZOOM SHOT, plane in background)

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The airplane whizzes by Kong, firing into him.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Kong is seen from the waist up. The bullet strikes him ab the chest. He staggers.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The girl watching, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Another airplane zooms by firing into Kong.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Again Kong is hit. He coughs. He looks down at the girl. looks at his wounds, realizes he is weakening. He moves t

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: -- pick her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stares at her with a puzzled, hurt look. The he put her --

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: -- down, straightens up, roars defiance up at the planes. coughs as he drums his chest, daring them to come on.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The remainder of the squadron dive together towards the Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: They sweep past Kong with a roar of machine guns. He staggers, turns and slowly topples off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kong as he falls to --

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: -- the street below. He lands beside the burning airplane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann lying on ledge. Driscoll, Denham, couple of cops rush as Kong goes over. Driscoll leaps across, gets Ann, he is incoherent with terror for her. He kisses her wildly, tal all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann! Ann! Are you all right? Oh, my darling, sure you're not hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ad lib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denham and one cop lean over the parapet looking down at fallen Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing a long breath) Gee, what a sight. Well, the aviators got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, 'twasn't the aviators (Cops looks question) It was Beauty killed the Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop stares at him, very puzzled.
